raw_text:
Wales critical of clumsy Grewcock
 
 Wales coach Mike Ruddock says England lock Danny Grewcock needs to review his actions after he kicked Dwayne Peel.
 
 Trouble flared at a ruck in the first half of Wales' 11-9 win in Cardiff as Grewcock came recklessly over the top with his boot, leaving Peel bloodied. Grewcock was sin-binned with Wales captain Gareth Thomas for retaliation. "It's up to the citing commissioner," said Ruddock. "I'm not saying it's deliberate, but Grewcock did a similar thing for Bath against Leinster." Last June Grewcock was banned from rugby for two months for reckless use of a boot in a match against New Zealand.
 
 Six years earlier, also in New Zealand, Grewcock became only the second England player to be sent off in Tests. The player himself and his captain Jason Robinson have both said that the clash with Peel was accidental. "If the ball is at the back of the ruck and I feel I can step over and disrupt it then I will do that," said Grewcock. But Ruddock feels that the England man should be more careful. "The boy himself should look at his actions, it was a clumsy piece of footwork," he said. "He's a great player and I don't want to knock him, we won't be calling for the match commissioner to review the incident. "I'm not going to go too far with the lad. It could just be a clumsy action and Dwayne had just a minor cut. "The referee's interpretation was that Grewcock was attempting to step over the ruck." Ruddock also warned his RBS 6 Nations Championship rivals that his team can make massive improvements. "We created more opportunities and also squandered them by taking more contact and playing more individually," said the coach. "We've looked through things on the video debrief and there were definitely a lot of chances that we wasted." In the forthcoming games, Ruddock may use penalty hero Gavin Henson as his first-choice kicker in place of Stephen Jones. "Our first aim was to get Gavin settled into the team, but it's something we'll talk about in selection this week," said Ruddock.
llama3.2:1b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock criticized England lock Danny Grewcock for kicking Dwayne Peel with reckless abandon after a ruck in Cardiff, and was also critical of his own captain Gareth Thomas's behavior during the incident.
Grewcock came recklessly over the top with his boot, leaving Peel bloodied, and was sin-binned by Wales captain Gareth Thomas.

Ruddock said that Grewcock "did a similar thing for Bath against Leinster" last June, and added that if the ball had been at the back of the ruck, Grewcock would have stepped over it to disrupt the play.
Wales coach Mike Ruddock felt that Grewcock should be more careful with his actions, but warned that the incident was not deliberate.
Instead, he said that "the boy himself should look at his actions", and emphasized that Wales won the match despite squandering opportunities due to their own contact and individual play.
Ruddock also expressed concerns about England's performance in the game, suggesting that they created more chances but wasted them through taking too much contact and playing individually.
He warned his team that they need to improve their teamwork and strategy to succeed.
llama3.2:3b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock criticizes England lock Danny Grewcock for kicking Dwayne Peel during a ruck in their 11-9 win, saying he needs to review his actions.
Grewcock was sin-binned and has a history of reckless boot use, including a two-month ban last year.

Ruddock believes Grewcock's footwork was clumsy and warns that Wales will make improvements in the RBS 6 Nations Championship, citing areas where they squandered opportunities and took too much contact individually.

Ruddock acknowledged Wales missed opportunities but highlighted potential improvement areas moving forward.
He also hinted at potentially using Gavin Henson as his first-choice kicker going forward.

Key points:
- Wales coach Mike Ruddock criticizes England lock Danny Grewcock for kicking Dwayne Peel off the field.
- Grewcock accidentally kicked Peel during a ruck encounter in Cardiff due to reckless use of his boot, leading to Peel's bloodied injury.
- The incident prompted Grewcock to be sin-binned with Gareth Thomas and his captain Gareth Southgate for retaliation.
- England head coach Steve Curry suggested Grewcock could have been more cautious or experienced.
- Ruddock believes Grewcock should review his actions and be more careful.
- Ruddock warns Wales against making big improvements based on the incident, such as using Gavin Henson as a first-choice kicker in place of Stephen Jones.
